subject: Re: Non Plus Ultra Coverage Measure?
msgSnippet: ... Agreed.  But, measuring coverage (and quality with a tool like JesTer) is useful with a group that is still learning to TDD properly.  It s not so much
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:

> No, because Test-Driven Development guarantees sufficiently high
> coverage, so I haven't found measuring test coverage to be useful.
> That's just personal taste.

Agreed. But, measuring coverage (and quality with a tool like JesTer)
is useful with a group that is still learning to TDD properly. It's
not so much looking for full coverage as an indication that all is
right, it's more looking for holes in the coverage that indicate that
tests are missing. And, yes, 100% is unrealistic because there will
always be things that don't need testing.. like toString methods that
are to make test results more meaningful.

Dave
